intro: Lithocarpus taitoensis, commonly known as the Taito chestnut, is a species of evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and other chestnut species. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a spiny husk. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
